title: The CCAP Tuesday Night Criterium Series
Cycle Fitness Summer Series
description:
2014 Cycle Fitness Summer Training Series
Presented by Cycle Fitness Cycling Club

title: Winsted Woods - Root 66 Series Race #5
description: Winsted Woods presented by Bikers Edge Root 66 Series Race #5 and Final Race in the CCAP High School Series
course: Course Description: The course is a challenging and technical 8 mile loop with 800 feet of elevation per lap. Everything is extremely well marked – same as last year. There will be new sections to the course this year. Above distances may change but you will be notified at the start the exact length of the course.
registration: Pre registration is available at www.bikereg.com and is $25 – must be completed before 11:59PM, March 16th – afterwards there is an $10 late fee, same applies to day of registration. One Day licenses are available for Cat 2 and Cat 3 only. Registration Opens at 8:00AM and closes 15 minutes prior to posted start times.
notes: Hot Food will be available all day, music and of course - bouncers for the kids. More information about the series is available at www.root66raceseries.com. Notes: Payouts will be 1-5 if at least 20 entries or 1-3 if less then 20 entries. The payouts will be up to half of the entry fees for Cat 1 and Pro Races. No refunds. Day of registration please pay with cash so we can payout with cash. Thank you!
directions: Directions: From Rte 44 Head West through the Center of Winsted Turn Right onto Spencer Street Turn Right onto Hinsdale Ave Turn Left onto Williams Ave Go to the end of the street and bear Right onto Williams Ave to the parking lot GPS: 200 Williams Ave, Winsted CT 06098 Contact info: Eric Carlson – 843-566-5259, email: teamedgecycling@gmail.com

title: CCNS Team and Individual State Time Trial
The Seven Lakes Ride
description: This is a fund raising event to benefit the patients of Eastern Connecticut Cancer Institute (ECCI) in Manchester, CT. Both routes are fully supported and begin in Stafford, CT.  The 45 and 62 mile routes will travel through the charming rural towns of Willington, Ashford, Union, and Woodstock then head into the quaint southeastern Massachusetts towns of Sturbridge, Holland, and Wales before returning to Stafford. The 20 and 25 mile routes will traverse the towns of Stafford, Willington, Union, Staffordville, and Stafford.  So come out and “Pedal for Patients”!!!
course:
There will be two rest stops on the 20/25 mile ride and several rest stops on the 45/62 mile ride.  Rest stops will be stocked with snacks (water, pbj’s, baked goods, granola bars, m&m’s, etc.) and will have a floor pump and basic repair tools.

Participants should ride with a tube, tire levers, pump, and patch kit in case of flat tires.   CPSC or US DOT approved helmets are required.

Please join us for refreshments/food after the ride to re-hydrate and nourish your tired legs!
registration:
Pre-register on BikeReg.com for the ride by June 19th 10:00 PM (EST.) https://www.bikereg.com/Net/the-seven-lakes-ride or onsite day of the event.
Day of ride registration will be an additional $10 for each ride so $35 for the 20/25 miler, $45 for the 45/62 miler.

title: EVEN Hotel Norwalk Connecticut Fun Ride
description: A fun ride to celebrate the opening of the EVEN Hotel in Norwalk CT, a hotel with a healthy lifestyle in mind.
course: Planned ~10 mile route, marked with spray chalk and/or direction arrows.
notes: This is not a race, this is a fun ride. There will be at least two ride leaders, one at the front and one at the back. All levels of riders welcome.
directions: Merritt Parkway in CT. Head north off of the Main Ave exit to 426 Main Ave in Norwalk CT. If heading south through Fairfield County then head south on Route 7, keep going straight when Route 7 turns right to go to the highway. EVEN Hotel is across the street from the Merritt 7 office buildings.

title: Rocky Hill Cyclocross Series
description: Cyclocross training series with junior practice and race.
course: Grassy fields, double track, gravel and barriers.  Course changes weekly to help introduce new riders to obstacles they will encounter at other races.
registration: Pre-reg is on Bikereg.com and closes 24 hours before series start date.
notes: Fundraiser for the CCAP,  This is a USAC event, all rules apply.  Helmets required when riding, mountain/cross bikes.  Flat bars permitted but no extensions/aerobars/horns
directions: I91 South:  Take exit 24 to Rt.  99 South to 5th light and turn right on Rt. 160 (Elm Street).  Follow 160 and turn left at the first light into Elm RIdge Park.  Follow driveway to back area by dog park.  I91 North:  Take exit 23 to West St.  Turn right at ext, at 2nd light turn left onto Gilbert Ave and follow to first stop sign.  Turn right on Elm St.  Follow Elm to first light, turn right into Elm Ridge Park.  Follow driveway to back area by dog park.

title: 3rd ANNUAL CCNS KERMIS
description:
3rd Annual CCNS Kermis-Belgian Hardman's style race
615 Silver Lane, East Hartford, CT
course: This Friday evening event will be a true Belgian Hardman's style race, with a challenging course around the Rentschler Stadium in East Hartford!  A kermis is a local race with a fair-like atmosphere and incredible racing.  The circuit style courses  usually consists of a 3-10 kilometer circuit on narrow, twisting, and sometimes  cobbled, roads that are open to all the elements: Wind, rain and more wind.
registration:
https://www.bikereg.com/3rd-annual-ccap-kermis 
Or "day of" available for $15 Extra.  One Day License will be available for new racers for $15.
notes: All USA Cycling Rules apply, promoter reserves the right to split or combine fields.  No aerobars or straight bars, no sleeveless jerseys, helmets required.
directions:
From North Take I-91 South toward Hartford to Exit 35A Route 291 South to I-84 West. Follow I-84 West to Exit 58, Roberts Street / Silver Lane. On the exit ramp, turn left and continue over I-84 and straight through the Silver Lane intersection into the RENTSCHLER FIELD MAIN GATE.

From South: Take I-91 North toward Hartford to Exit 25, Route 3N. Merge left onto Route 3 North. Merge into left lane. Exit Route 3 North onto Route 2 West. Follow Route 2 West to Exit 5A Main Street. Merge onto Main Street and continue straight through the Brewer Street intersection Continue on Main Street and turn Right into the RENTSCHLER FIELD WILLOW STREET GATE

From West: Take I-84 East toward Hartford. Follow I-84 East to Exit 58, Roberts Street / Silver Lane. On the exit ramp, keep to the right and continue straight through the Silver Lane intersection into the RENTSCHLER FIELD MAIN GATE.

title: Silk City Cyclocross
description: Join us at the Aetna Silk City Cyclocross race on September 13th!   The first stop of the 2nd annual Connecticut Series of Cyclocross.  A portion of each race entry will be donated to the MCC Foundation Scholarship Fund.
course: 2 miles of turny fun with some very challenging climbs and technical features thrown in just o balance it out.  Many people have called this the most fun course around.
registration:
USA Cycling license required.  One-day licenses can be purchased at registration for $15.  Day of registration will be available from 7:30am until ½ hour before scheduled start time for all fields; a $10 day of registration fee will apply (except Juniors U-15).  Additional races only $10.  Promoter reserves the right to cancel or combine fields with less than 10 pre-registered riders.  Fields that pay 5 places must have a minimum of 20 riders.  Less than 20 will pay 3 places.
Juniors race for FREE:  We'll pay all the fees including the one-day license if you need one.  You don't have to race a junior field to qualify.  Pre-register here if you want to race another category field and we'll comp you at registration. Sorry kids, only one free race.
All National and New England Regional Cyclocross Champions - Free entry: Limited to the field that you are the champion of and you must wear your championship jersey in that race. Second race at the reduced second race rate.  Pre-reg here and you will receive a comp at race registration.
All USA Cycling rules apply.  Mountain bikes without bar-ends are acceptable.  Helmets are required at all times.  Jerseys must have sleeves (no tank-tops or vests).
notes:
Centrally located minutes east of Hartford, Ct.
1.5 hours from Boston
2 hours from New York City
2 hours from Albany
directions:
Exit 1 off I-384, follow signs to Manchester Community College.  
Parking is in the "B" lot.
Do Not got to Bidwell Street.  That entrance will be closed.  You need to enter campus off Hillstown Road.

title: Connor's Angel Bike Ride - 2nd Annual
description:
10 mile fun ride through the streets of North Haven CT.
25 mile ride through the rolling hills of North Haven, Wallingford, and North Branford CT.
Both rides support the Connor Kusmit Foundation. Connor at 16 was killed by a distracted driver while riding his bicycle less than a mile from his home. The mission of the Connor Kusmit Foundation is to educate and raise awareness about bicycle and road safety to prevent accidents. If we can save one life, we have accomplished our mission.
course: Both rides start and end at the North Haven Fair Grounds on Pools Raod, North Haven CT (rear entrance)
registration:
All registrations for the rides  will be done on the connorkusmitfoundation.org web site
Early registration begins 7/16 - 8/14        $30.00.
Registration 8/15 - 9/14 (day of event)    $35.00.

Day of Event (9/14)
25 mile ride - Registration opens 8:00am. Ride 9.00am.
Minimum age 16 yrs old
10 mile ride - Registration opens 9:00am  Ride 10:00am.
Minimum age 12 yrs old
notes:
HELMETS ARE REQUIRED FOR ALL RIDERS

All riders must have a signed release to participate.
All riders 12 - 18  must have a release signed by a parent or guardian.  

Riders 12 - 15 must ride with a parent or guardian. They will be restricted to the 10 mile ride.
directions: North Have Fair Grounds Pool Road North Haven CT (rear entrance)

title: Riverfront Cross of Hartford
course: Flat and rolling terrain. One steep long hillside, deep sand, wooded section, off cambers with a small paved section. Course is flat and fast.
registration:
Register on line at Bikereg:  https://www.bikereg.com/riverfront-cross-of-hartford 
Register day of (post cutoff fee applies) on site.
directions: From Connecticut Interstate 91 North or South Jennings Road Exit #33. Follow the signs to Riverfront Park. Parking on site.

title: CCAP CT Cycling Festival Grand Fondo
description: The CT CYCLING FESTIVAL'S CT Gran Fondo 100 and the CT Gran Fondo 45
course: The Connecticut Cycling Festival’s Connecticut Gran Fondo rides range consist of two beautiful and epic rides through the Southern Connecticut River Valley. These challenging rides will take you through some of the most scenic riding Connecticut has to offer, while highlighting CT’s historic Bed and Breakfasts along the way. You will finish each day at the heart of the festival in downtown Hartford, where you’re invited to participate in festivities, in partnership with downtown Hartford’s Envisionfest, and relax under the shade of our tents as you enjoy plenty of food and beverages.
registration:
$85 -- Through August 1st
$95 -- August 2nd to September 12th
$105 -- The week of September 13th to September 19th. Registration for the fondo CLOSES September 19th and is limited to 500 riders!
notes:
Fully staffed and stocked rest stops with endless food, drink and medical/mechanical support.
A CCAP Connecticut Gran Fondo Finishers T-Shirt. 6:30 am - Check-in Opens Saturday in Bushnell Park, near the ride start
7:40 am - Staging by Event Categary and Pace– VIC’s, Followed by 100 Milers, Followed by 40 milers*
3:00 pm - All courses close, route support ends**
* Please stage yourself at the start according to your average speed.
** A sweep vehicle driver will advise slower riders of their option to continue unsupported or SAG to the finish when route support ends.
An exceptional post-ride festival with food, drink and loads of entertainment, in partnership with downtown Hartford’s Envisionfest. All Fondo riders will be timed and will start at 8 am.

title: CCAP CT Cycling Festival Criterium
description: RACE AT THE CT CYCLING FESTIVAL! The Connecticut Cycling Festival will feature a unique and challenging 8-corner course in the heart of the downtown Hartford.
course: 8 corner course in the heart of downtown Hartford.
notes: Day of registration available for additional $10, registration closes 20 minutes prior to each race.  Day of licences available for $15.  Annual licenses available on site.  All racers will need to present current USAC license at registration.  Junior rollout following their event.
directions:
Start line address: 2225 Trumbull Street, 
Hartford, CT  06103

title: CCAP CT Cycling Festival Urban MTB Race
description: Urban Mountain Bike Race, head to head, two racers at a time competing in qualifying heats.
course: Out and back over man made obstacles incorporating urban terrain, pavement, ramps and berms.

title: Ashford Metric Century+
description: This is a fund raising event to benefit the Ashford Recreation Department. All routes are fully supported and include the quiet and rolling hills of Ashford, Eastford and Woodstock. Come out and enjoy the stunning fall foliage in classic New England.
course: Supported routes with rest stops of 10, 26, 62 and 100 miles.
directions:
Ride starts at Ashford Elementary School on Route 89 in Ashford, CT

Ashford Elementary School

440 Westford Rd.

Ashford, CT 06278

From the South and Willimantic:

From Willimantic take Route 195 north toward The University of Connecticut. In Mansfield Center turn right onto Route 89. Follow Route 89 north into Ashford. Cross Route 44. Ashford School is located on Route 89 2 miles north of the intersection with Route 44.

From the West and Hartford:

Take I-84 East to Exit 69. Turn right onto Route 74. Follow Route 74 through Willington to Route 44 in Ashford. Turn left on Route 44 to the intersection of Route 89. Turn left on Route 89. The school is on the right 2 miles to the north.

From the North and Massachusetts:

Take I-84 to Exit 72. Turn left on Route 89. Follow Route 89 (south) watching the signs because it turns twice. Ashford School is located on the left side of Route 89 about 6 miles from I-84.

From the East and Rhode Island:

From the Rhode Island border take Route 101 west. It merges with Route 44 in Pomfret. Continue on Route 44 west until Route 89 in Ashford. Turn right on Route 89. Ashford school is located on the right about 2 miles north of Route 44.

title: CCAP Cyclocross Series

address.street: Hartford County 4H Outdoor Center, 247 S Rd

course: Grassy fields, off camber sections, stairs, paved and dirt roads, sand pit.
registration: Pre-registration is on Bikereg.com, closes 24 hours prior to event.  Day of registration onsite.  One day licenses as well as annual licenses available onsite as well.
notes: Fundraiser for the CCAP, This is a USAC event, all rules apply. Helmets required when riding, mountain/cross bikes. Flat bars permitted but no extensions/aerobars/horns
directions: The 4-H Outdoor Center is located at 247 South Rd, Marlborough, CT 06447.  Directions to camp: Drive east from Hartford on Rt. 2. Take Exit 13. Turn right at Rt. 66.  Turn left at the four-way intersection; proceed 0.7 of a mile. Bear right at the fork onto South Rd. Proceed 2.3 miles to the Outdoor Center.

title: TCC- Mansfield Hollow Cyclocross
course: 2.5 - 3 K course with varying terrain, off camber sections, deep sand, and multiple dismounts.
registration: Register online at:  https://www.bikereg.com/mansfield-hollow-cyclocross  or the day of the event at least an hour before your event starts.
directions: From the North, Exit 68 of I-84 Head south 11.5 miles on Route 195. Left on Bassetts Bridge Road and proceed 3/4 of a mile on the right. From the East and Providence Route 6 west to North Windham CT.  Right on North Main Street at the intersection of CT.203. Straight at stop sign over bridge, proceed 2 miles Parking and race is on the left side of the road. From Willimantic and points south: Route 195 North Right on Bassetts Bridge Road and proceed 3/4 of a mile on the right.

course: Racing thru orchards , corn Maze , Great climbs, off-Camber ,fire road ,Fields
notes: Race and get you christmas tree at the same time
directions: from the north ,route 63 south to 109 west to 61 south .make a right on Bellamy lane  to the end .March farms is straight ahead.
